roles: student
supporting_quotes: She further attended Henley Management College in 1989 but she does not hold a formal bachelor's degree.

roles: employee
supporting_quotes: Between 1981 and 1991, Mohammed worked with Archcon Nigeria, an architectural design firm in association with Norman and Dawbarn United Kingdom.

roles: founder
Executive Director
supporting_quotes: She founded Afri-Projects Consortium in 1991 and served as its Executive Director until 2001.

roles: Task Force on Gender and Education coordinator
supporting_quotes: From 2002 until 2005, Mohammed coordinated the Task Force on Gender and Education for the United Nations Millennium Project.

organizations: Office of the President of Nigeria
roles: Senior Special Assistant to the President on Millennium Development Goals
supporting_quotes: Mohammed later acted as the Senior Special Assistant to the President of Nigeria on the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs).

roles: coordinator of Nigeria's debt relief funds toward achievement of MDGs
supporting_quotes: In 2005, she was charged with the coordination of Nigeria's debt relief funds toward the achievement of the MDGs.

roles: founder
CEO
supporting_quotes: Amina Mohammed later became the founder and CEO of the Center for Development Policy Solutions

roles: adjunct professor for Master's in Development Practice program
supporting_quotes: Amina Mohammed later became the founder and CEO of the Center for Development Policy Solutions and as an adjunct professor for the Master's in Development Practice program at Columbia University.

roles: member of UN Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: During that time, she served on numerous international advisory boards and panels, including the UN Secretary-General's High-level Panel on Post-2015 Development Agenda

roles: member of Independent Expert Advisory Group on the Data Revolution for Sustainable Development
supporting_quotes: From 2014, she also served on the Secretary-General's Independent Expert Advisory Group on the Data Revolution for Sustainable Development.

roles: chair of Advisory Board of UNESCO Global Monitoring Report on Education
supporting_quotes: She also chaired the Advisory Board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) Global Monitoring Report on Education (GME).

roles: Special Adviser to UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Post-2015 development planning
supporting_quotes: From 2012, Mohammed was a key player in the Post-2015 Development Agenda process, serving as the Special Adviser to UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on Post-2015 development planning.

roles: Federal Minister of the Environment
supporting_quotes: Mohammed served as Federal Minister of the Environment in the First Cabinet of President Muhammadu Buhari from November 2015 to February 2017.
She resigned from the Nigerian Federal Executive Council on 24 February 2017.

roles: Nigeria's representative in AU Reform Steering Committee
supporting_quotes: During that time, she was Nigeria's representative in the African Union (AU) Reform Steering Committee, chaired by Paul Kagame.

roles: Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations
supporting_quotes: Amina Jane Mohammed GCON (born 27 June 1961) is a Nigerian-British diplomat and politician who is serving as the 5th Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations.
In January 2017, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres announced his intention to appoint Mohammed Deputy Secretary-General of the United Nations.

roles: Chair
supporting_quotes: She is also Chair of United Nations Sustainable Development Group.

organizations: UN Interagency Coordination Group on Antimicrobial Resistance
roles: member
supporting_quotes: In this capacity, she is a member of the UN Interagency Coordination Group on Antimicrobial Resistance (IACG).
